intro: Senecio talinoides subsp. aizoides, commonly known as the Aizoides groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing succulent leaves adapted to conserve water. Its yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often used in rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
